alert.note: Alert for Madison (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 5:14PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Madison County through 600 PM EDT... At 514 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Madison to 6 miles northwest of Dowling Park. Movement was northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Madison, Lee, Hanson and Hopewell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
